Instrument.name: Aarhus Wind Tunnel AWTSI 2004
Instrument.description: A low-pressure recirculating wind tunnel. The wind tunnels are used for the multi-disciplinary scientific study of aerosol formation and transport (on Mars and Earth), granular electrification, magnetic properties, erosion, cohesion/adhesion, water transport, UV induced mineralogy, bacterial survival and much more. The wind tunnels are accessible to national and international collaborators and space agencies for scientific experiments, instrument testing, calibration and qualification. The wind tunnels have been financed by Aarhus University, the European Space Agency (ESA) and the Villum Kann Rasmussen Foundation.
